result.execSummary:
The defendant Nequann D Terry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
All court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.

All terms are concurrent with 14CF4812
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF4812.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nequann D Terry

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION 500 EAST PARRISH ST. P.O.BOX 6000 PRAIRIE DU CHIEN WISCONSIN 53821

IT IS ORDERED

that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED

that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within SIX (6) working days upon receipt of this Order.

IN ALL OTHER RESPECTS THE ORIGINAL JUDGMENT HEREIN IS AFFIRMED.

Signed and filed, sdg.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 33, Judge Ashley.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript commencing 6/1/2016 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF4812 (19 Pages).
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Nequann D Terry in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Nequann D Terry in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of FIFTY-FOUR (54) MONTHS, with credit for TWO HUNDRED AND NINETEEN (219) days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is THIRTY (30) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  ALL TERMS ARE CONCURRENT TO 14CF4812.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
* Court ordered Defendant's motor vehicle operating privileges SUSPENDED for a period of SIX (6) MONTHS.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Nequann D Terry in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Nequann D Terry in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Count 1:    The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED, but read-in as to sentencing.

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Held off the record. Case set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. State to provide reports of expert witness no later than 8-10-2015 by 5:00 pm. Any motion due no later than 8-24-2015 by 5:00 pm. Response due no later than 9-11-2015 by 5:00 pm. Copies mailed to state and defense counsel. Motion Hearing remains scheduled for 09-17-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 10-01-15 at 08:30 am, and Jury Trial scheduled on 10-19-2015 at 09:00 am, Branch 17. Effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Nequann D Terry not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. Court granted defense counsel's request for an adjournment, and a new motion hearing date was selected. Parties are to notify the Court by 06/26/2015 if the selected motion hearing date does not work for the necessary witness. Court ordered plea hearing date of 06/26/2015 vacated. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
